title: 1. Spatial Units
text: creation streetblocks requires two input datasets: - polygon representing extents study area, - linestrings representing highways/ streets study area. Typically, study area extents pre-defined known us (administrative municipal boundary within particular city region). vignette, ’ll define location center Bangalore draw 500m buffer around . can use buffer bounding box download highways/ streets OpenStreetMap. Note: datasets included multi can accessed using data() function. code chunk uses datasets draw street blocks. Aside setting merge_threshold = NULL, use function defaults. Notice function warns us presence small geometries (< m^2). small geometries often created input data contains multiple linestrings close proximity. Awkward street intersections small traffic islands also result small geometries. address , can either define non-null merge_threshold value (m^2) creating street blocks use st_merge_spatialunits function subsequently. can also use st_survey_spatialunits() function get overview current sizes. st_merge_spatialunits() function uses iterative merging process. Please refer Iterative Merging Vignette details. , use 4050 m^2 merge threshold max_shared_boundary merge type.
code: # Define the study area extents.  bangalore_boundary <- data.frame(lat = c(12.964045),                          long = c(77.585611)) |>    sf::st_as_sf(coords = c("long", "lat"),                crs = 4326) |>    sf::st_transform(3857) |>    sf::st_buffer(500,                 endCapStyle = "SQUARE") |>    sf::st_transform(4326) |>    sf::st_make_valid()  bangalore_boundary # Download highways from OpenStreetMap  bangalore_highways <- osmdata::opq(bbox = sf::st_bbox(bangalore_boundary)) |>    osmdata::add_osm_feature("highway") |>    osmdata::osmdata_sf() |>    purrr::pluck("osm_lines")  |>    dplyr::select(osm_id, highway, geometry)  |>    sf::st_make_valid()  bangalore_highways # Load data as included in the package.  data("bangalore_buildings") # Load for the map. data("bangalore_highways") # Draw street blocks.  bangalore_streetblocks <- multi::st_create_streetblocks(x = bangalore_highways,                                                         boundary = bangalore_boundary,                                                         merge_threshold = NULL,                                                         verbose = TRUE)  bangalore_streetblocks  tmap::tm_shape(bangalore_buildings) +   tmap::tm_fill(col = "#d9d9d9") +   tmap::tm_shape(bangalore_streetblocks) +   tmap::tm_borders() +   tmap::tm_layout(frame = FALSE) multi::st_survey_spatialunits(bangalore_streetblocks,                               trim = 0.3) # Merge spatial units.  bangalore_streetblocks_merged <- multi::st_merge_spatialunits(x = bangalore_streetblocks,                                                               merge_threshold = 4050,                                                               merge_type = "max_shared_boundary",                                                               verbose = FALSE)  bangalore_streetblocks_merged  tmap::tm_shape(bangalore_buildings) +   tmap::tm_fill(col = "#d9d9d9") +   tmap::tm_shape(bangalore_streetblocks_merged) +   tmap::tm_borders() +   tmap::tm_layout(frame = FALSE)

title: 1. Spatial Units
text: process creating morphological tessellation units (MTs) similar process drawing streetblocks. major difference require data building polygons rather highway/ street linestrings. data can also obtained OpenStreetMap. , example data included package. code chunk uses datasets draw MTs. use default values segment_length, shrink_extent, contiguity. skip merging process now. (Please refer Fleischmann et al., 2020 details segment_length shrink_extent.) similar alternative implementation function create MTs available moter package.
code: # Download buildings from OpenStreetMap.  bangalore_buildings <- osmdata::opq(bbox = sf::st_bbox(bangalore_boundary)) |>    osmdata::add_osm_feature("building") |>    osmdata::osmdata_sf() |>    purrr::pluck("osm_polygons") |>    dplyr::select(osm_id, geometry) |>    sf::st_make_valid() # Draw MTUs.  bangalore_mtus <- multi::st_create_tessellations(x = bangalore_buildings,                                                  boundary = bangalore_boundary,                                                  merge_threshold = NULL,                                                  verbose = FALSE)  bangalore_mtus  tmap::tm_shape(bangalore_buildings) +   tmap::tm_fill(col = "#d9d9d9") +   tmap::tm_shape(bangalore_mtus) +   tmap::tm_borders() +   tmap::tm_layout(frame = FALSE)

title: 1. Spatial Units

what: Utility Functions For Urban Morphometric Analyses
title: Utility Functions For Urban Morphometric Analyses
text: Warning package active development. API may change. multi (Morphometric UtiLiTIes) provides utility functions make basic steps — cleaning street networks, creating spatial units, etc. — urban morphometric analyses easier. multi meant work packages R ecosystem , , duplicate already implemented functionality.

title: Utility Functions For Urban Morphometric Analyses
text: can install development version multi GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("anirudhgovind/multi")

what: Create proximity band spatial units. — st_create_proximitybands
title: Create proximity band spatial units. — st_create_proximitybands
text: Create proximity band spatial units.

title: Create proximity band spatial units. — st_create_proximitybands
code: st_create_proximitybands(   x,   band_width = 10,   segment_length = 2,   merge_threshold = 1015,   merge_type = "min_centroid_distance",   contiguity = "rook",   verbose = T )

title: Create proximity band spatial units. — st_create_proximitybands
text: x sf object LINESTRING geometries representing street network. band_width numeric; width band measured centerline LINESTRING representing street. segment_length numeric; Length segments street linestrings subdivided . Default = 2. merge_threshold numeric; value represents smallest acceptable size spatial unit. Contiguous units iteratively merged value reached. skip process, set merge_threshold = NULL. See st_merge_spatialunits() details. merge_type string; Passed st_merge_spatialunits(). Criteria polygons merged. Must one "min_centroid_distance", "min_shared_boundary", "max_shared_boundary". Default = "min_centroid_distance". See st_merge_spatialunits() details. contiguity string; one "queen" "rook". Default = "rook". verbose logical; FALSE status messages output.

title: Create proximity band spatial units. — st_create_proximitybands
text: sf object POLYGON geometries representing tessellated spatial units.

title: Create proximity band spatial units. — st_create_proximitybands
text: Araldi, ., & Fusco, G. (2019). street metropolitan region: Pedestrian perspective urban fabric analysis. Environment Planning B: Urban Analytics City Science, 46(7), 1243–1263. https://doi.org/10.1177/2399808319832612

title: Create proximity band spatial units. — st_create_proximitybands
code: proximity_bands <- st_create_proximitybands(x = bangalore_highways, verbose = FALSE, merge_threshold = NULL) #> Spherical geometry (s2) switched off #> Error in dplyr::summarise(dplyr::group_by(voronoi_polygons, temp_id),     geometry = sf::st_union(geometry)): ℹ In argument: `geometry = sf::st_union(geometry)`. #> ℹ In group 1: `temp_id = 1`. #> Caused by error in `UseMethod()`: #> ! no applicable method for 'st_union' applied to an object of class "NULL" plot(proximity_bands) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'proximity_bands' not found

what: Create street block spatial units. — st_create_streetblocks
title: Create street block spatial units. — st_create_streetblocks
text: Create street block spatial units.

title: Create street block spatial units. — st_create_streetblocks
code: st_create_streetblocks(   x,   boundary,   merge_threshold = 4050,   merge_type = "min_centroid_distance",   contiguity = "rook",   verbose = T )

title: Create street block spatial units. — st_create_streetblocks
text: x sf object LINESTRING geometries representing street network. boundary sf object POLYGON geometries representing extents study area. merge_threshold numeric; value represents smallest acceptable size spatial unit. Contiguous units iteratively merged value reached. skip process, set merge_threshold = NULL. See st_merge_spatialunits() details. merge_type string; Passed st_merge_spatialunits. Criteria polygons merged. Must one "min_centroid_distance", "min_shared_boundary", "max_shared_boundary". Default = "min_centroid_distance". See st_merge_spatialunits() details. contiguity string; one "queen" "rook". Default = "rook". verbose logical; FALSE status messages output.

title: Create street block spatial units. — st_create_streetblocks
text: sf object POLYGON geometries representing street block spatial units.

title: Create street block spatial units. — st_create_streetblocks
code: street_blocks <- st_create_streetblocks(x = bangalore_highways, boundary = bangalore_boundary, merge_threshold = 1, verbose = FALSE) #> Warning: The `sf` geometry column was renamed before merging. #> Linking to GEOS 3.10.2, GDAL 3.4.1, PROJ 8.2.1; sf_use_s2() is FALSE plot(street_blocks)

title: Create tessellated spatial units. — st_create_tessellations
text: Create tessellated spatial units.

title: Create tessellated spatial units. — st_create_tessellations
code: st_create_tessellations(   x,   boundary,   type = "morphological",   segment_length = 0.5,   shrink_extent = 0.4,   merge_threshold = NULL,   merge_type = "min_centroid_distance",   contiguity = "rook",   verbose = T )

title: Create tessellated spatial units. — st_create_tessellations
text: x sf object POLYGON geometries representing buildings. boundary sf object POLYGON geometries representing extents study area. type string; Type tessellated spatial unit create. Default = "morphological". Note: Currently, "morphological" tessellation implemented. segment_length numeric; Length segments building polygons subdivided . Default = 0.5. See Fleischmann et al., 2020 details. shrink_extent numeric; Extent inward buffer building polygons. Default = 0.4. See Fleischmann et al., 2020 details. merge_threshold numeric; value represents smallest acceptable size spatial unit. Contiguous units iteratively merged value reached. skip process, set merge_threshold = NULL. See st_merge_spatialunits() details. merge_type string; Passed st_merge_spatialunits(). Criteria polygons merged. Must one "min_centroid_distance", "min_shared_boundary", "max_shared_boundary". Default = "min_centroid_distance". See st_merge_spatialunits() details. contiguity string; one "queen" "rook". Default = "rook". verbose logical; FALSE status messages output.

title: Create tessellated spatial units. — st_create_tessellations
text: sf object POLYGON geometries representing tessellated spatial units.

title: Create tessellated spatial units. — st_create_tessellations
text: Fleischmann, M., Feliciotti, ., Romice, O., & Porta, S. (2020). Morphological tessellation way partitioning space: Improving consistency urban morphology plot scale. Computers, Environment Urban Systems, 80, 101441.

title: Create tessellated spatial units. — st_create_tessellations
code: tessellations <- st_create_tessellations(x = bangalore_buildings, boundary = bangalore_boundary, segment_length = 0.5, shrink_extent = 0.4, merge_threshold = NULL, verbose = FALSE) #> Error in dplyr::summarise(dplyr::group_by(voronoi_polygons, temp_id),     geometry = sf::st_union(geometry)): ℹ In argument: `geometry = sf::st_union(geometry)`. #> ℹ In group 1: `temp_id = 1`. #> Caused by error in `UseMethod()`: #> ! no applicable method for 'st_union' applied to an object of class "NULL" plot(tessellations) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'tessellations' not found

text: sf object POINT geometries representing street intersections.

what: Iteratively merge spatial units to ensure all of them meet a minimum area threshold. — st_merge_spatialunits
title: Iteratively merge spatial units to ensure all of them meet a minimum area threshold. — st_merge_spatialunits
text: Iteratively merge spatial units ensure meet minimum area threshold.

title: Iteratively merge spatial units to ensure all of them meet a minimum area threshold. — st_merge_spatialunits
code: st_merge_spatialunits(   x,   merge_threshold,   merge_type = "min_centroid_distance",   contiguity = "rook",   verbose = T )

title: Iteratively merge spatial units to ensure all of them meet a minimum area threshold. — st_merge_spatialunits
text: x sf object POLYGON geometries representing spatial units merged. merge_threshold numeric; value square meters represents smallest acceptable area spatial unit. Contiguous units iteratively merged value reached. skip process, set merge_threshold = NULL. merge_type string; criteria polygons merged. Must one "min_centroid_distance", "min_adjacent_area", "max_adjacent_area", "min_shared_boundary", "max_shared_boundary". Default = "min_centroid_distance". contiguity string; one "queen" "rook". Default = "rook". verbose logical; FALSE status messages output.

title: Iteratively merge spatial units to ensure all of them meet a minimum area threshold. — st_merge_spatialunits
text: sf object POLYGON geometries representing street block spatial units.

title: Iteratively merge spatial units to ensure all of them meet a minimum area threshold. — st_merge_spatialunits
code: street_blocks <- st_create_streetblocks(x = bangalore_highways, boundary = bangalore_boundary, merge_threshold = NULL, verbose = FALSE) #> Warning: Small geometries (< 1 m^2) may be present. Use st_merge_spatialunits() to aggregate them. street_blocks_merged <- st_merge_spatialunits(x = street_blocks, merge_threshold = 4050, verbose = FALSE) #> Warning: The `sf` geometry column was renamed before merging. plot(street_blocks_merged)

what: Survey a set of spatial units to get summary statistics. — st_survey_spatialunits

title: Survey a set of spatial units to get summary statistics. — st_survey_spatialunits
text: x sf object POLYGON geometries representing spatial units surveyed. trim numeric; fraction (0 0.5) values trimmed lower end compute trimmed mean. viz binary; Displays scatterplot area distributions.

title: Survey a set of spatial units to get summary statistics. — st_survey_spatialunits
text: data.frame object numeric values min, max, mean, median.

title: Survey a set of spatial units to get summary statistics. — st_survey_spatialunits
code: street_blocks <- st_create_streetblocks(x = bangalore_highways, boundary = bangalore_boundary, merge_threshold = NULL, verbose = FALSE) #> Warning: Small geometries (< 1 m^2) may be present. Use st_merge_spatialunits() to aggregate them. survey_report <- st_survey_spatialunits(x = street_blocks)  #>   category description value              #> 1 Area     Min         8.259066e-01 [m^2] #> 2 Area     Max         8.031008e+04 [m^2] #> 3 Area     Mean        3.006233e+03 [m^2] #> 4 Area     Median      3.006233e+03 [m^2] survey_report #>   category description              value #> 1     Area         Min 8.259066e-01 [m^2] #> 2     Area         Max 8.031008e+04 [m^2] #> 3     Area        Mean 3.006233e+03 [m^2] #> 4     Area      Median 3.006233e+03 [m^2]
